definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: BZ was eventually put in hand grenades and a 750 pound cluster bomb.
sentences.chinese: BZ最終被放進手榴彈和750磅的集束炸彈中。

sentences.english: The cluster shells were discovered in the area shot by the Cambodian side, " said Panitan Wattanayagorn, the government spokesman."
sentences.chinese: 我們在柬埔寨火力攻擊的地區發現了集束炸彈的彈殼。

sentences.english: The Thai government denies using cluster bombs.
sentences.chinese: 泰國政府否認使用了集束炸彈。

sentences.english: The host was the Royal Bank of Scotland, a major investor in cluster bombs.
sentences.chinese: 主持商則是集束炸彈的主要投資商，蘇格蘭皇家銀行。

sentences.english: The cluster shells were discovered in the area shot by the Cambodian side," said Panitan Wattanayagorn, the government spokesman.
sentences.chinese: 我們在柬埔寨火力攻擊的地區發現了集束炸彈的彈殼。
